meanings.definition: Caryatides: a sculpted female figure serving as an architectural support in place of a column or pillar.
meanings.sent1: The caryatides stood gracefully, holding up the roof of the ancient temple.
meanings.sent2: The architect decided to use caryatides instead of columns for the grand entrance.
meanings.sent3: The caryatides whispered secrets to each other while supporting the heavy structure.
meanings.sent4: The caryatides bore the weight of the building with unwavering strength.
meanings.sent5: Visitors marveled at the intricate details of the caryatides as they entered the hall.
